data.title: RAILROAD OPERATING INFORMATION
data.text:
METRA

Rock Island District/Beverly Subdistrict

FORMERLY Chicago Rock Island & Pacific Railroad (Rock Island Lines)

(CRI&P Subdivision 1A)

CONSTRUCTED 1870

DOUBLE TRACK constructed before 1892

CTC installed 2018

COMMUTER SERVICE: Metra Rock Island District

The Beverly Branch originally followed 99th St. after diverging from the Main Line, relocated to 89th St. around 1889. Until 1971, Baltimore & Ohio passenger trains used this route between Elizabeth Street (formerly Brainerd Jct.) and Beverly Jct. East of Brainerd Jct., now abandoned trackage crossed the Rock Island main line, connecting with the former Rock Island South Chicago Branch, which is now Chicago Rail Link. And northwest of Beverly Jct., now abandoned trackage connected with what now is the CSX Blue Island Subdivision at 79th Street. Until 2018, that line had an unusual method of operation which involved time spacing. There were basically no block signals, and control operators at the Gresham Jct. and Blue Island towers were required to not allow following trains to enter the line until after 10 minutes.

CLICK FOR RAILFAN TIPS AND PHOTOS

Radio Frequency - 161.340 (AAR Channel 82)
